GOD.content: acc. Patočka, allows demonic to return in orgiastic irresponsibility, heightening of orgiastic, individualism as role not person
GOD.linkedContent: acc. Patočka, allows demonic to return in orgiastic irresponsibility, heightening of orgiastic, individualism as role not person

R.content: technique, “technical measure of equality” is not a mishap, chance for incommensurable, technique before calculating technique [?] [POOF]
R.linkedContent: technique, “technical measure of equality” is not a mishap, chance for incommensurable, technique before calculating technique [?] [POOF]

R.content: both Plato & Aristotle maintain political turn toward or salutation of One God, where arkhē has at his disposal tekhnē, for Plato not utopia, prayer, but very difficult
R.linkedContent: both Plato & Aristotle maintain political turn toward or salutation of One God, where arkhē has at his disposal tekhnē, for Plato not utopia, prayer, but very difficult

FK.content: technology & religion: “ether of religion has always been hospitable to a certain spectral virtuality”  [return of virtual from OOG]
FK.linkedContent: technology & religion: “ether of religion has always been hospitable to a certain spectral virtuality” [return of virtual from OOG]

FK.content: technoscience: bears, supports, and supposes religion
FK.linkedContent: technoscience: bears, supports, and supposes religion

FK.content: religion & technoscience (fatal logic of the auto-immunity of the unscathed)
FK.linkedContent: religion & technoscience (fatal logic of the auto-immunity of the unscathed)

FK.content: the “lights” and Enlightenment of tele-technoscientific critique and reason suppose trustworthiness
FK.linkedContent: the “lights” and Enlightenment of tele-technoscientific critique and reason suppose trustworthiness

FK.content: machine (technē) & sacrosanct: one and same possibility
knowledge & faith, technoscience & religion, alliance of calculable and incalculable
FK.linkedContent: knowledge & faith, technoscience & religion, alliance of calculable and incalculable

FK.content: the 2 types of auto-immune supplementarity imposed by religious reactivity to technology: 1) violent sundering (Entwürzelung) from all roots, all sacred: identity, proper name, culture, memory 2) counter-fetishism, animism of technology as evil [See H p. 53 & SPOM p. 64]
FK.linkedContent: the 2 types of auto-immune supplementarity imposed by religious reactivity to technology: 1) violent sundering (Entwürzelung) from all roots, all sacred: identity, proper name, culture, memory 2) counter-fetishism, animism of technology as evil [See H p. 53 & SPOM p. 64]

FK.content: “contemporary” movements (ecologists, humanists…) search for salvation in new alliance btwn tele-technoscientific & two sources of religion: 1) heilig, unscathed 2) faith, belief
FK.linkedContent: “contemporary” movements (ecologists, humanists…) search for salvation in new alliance btwn tele-technoscientific & two sources of religion: 1) heilig, unscathed 2) faith, belief

H.content: to-and-fro btwn urgency of end-of-millenium and tradition from which we receive axioms, vocabulary, concepts: techno-political-scientific mutation obliges deconstruction
H.linkedContent: to-and-fro btwn urgency of end-of-millenium and tradition from which we receive axioms, vocabulary, concepts: techno-political-scientific mutation obliges deconstruction

H.content: technological prostheses, whose refinements are unlimited in principle > still give fantasy of auto-nomy, auto-affection: is there hospitality w/out this, w/out auto-affection, the privileged figure of hearing oneself speak?
H.linkedContent: technological prostheses, whose refinements are unlimited in principle > still give fantasy of auto-nomy, auto-affection: is there hospitality w/out this, w/out auto-affection, the privileged figure of hearing oneself speak?

H.content: urgent contemporary matters [new technologies] not only bring classical structures into present, they seem to deconstruct these inheritances of themselves
H.linkedContent: urgent contemporary matters [new technologies] not only bring classical structures into present, they seem to deconstruct these inheritances of themselves

H.content: p. anne 64 hospitality threatens a world founded on transparency and quantification?
H.linkedContent: p. anne 64 hospitality threatens a world founded on transparency and quantification?

AF.content: does the psyche transform w/ technological advancements or does it find itself better represented?
AF.linkedContent: does the psyche transform w/ technological advancements or does it find itself better represented?

AF.content: the prosthetic, hypomnesic techniques of archive not only place for storing, but also determine structure of the archivable content in its very coming into existence, in its relationship to the future
AF.linkedContent: the prosthetic, hypomnesic techniques of archive not only place for storing, but also determine structure of the archivable content in its very coming into existence, in its relationship to the future

SPOM.content: Marx rare thinker of past to think originary indissociability of technics and language, tele-technics
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx rare thinker of past to think originary indissociability of technics and language, tele-technics

SPOM.content: techno-mediatic power that conditions and endangers any democracy
SPOM.linkedContent: techno-mediatic power that conditions and endangers any democracy

SPOM.content: techno-tele-media apparatuses don’t affect only the facts but concept of “facts”
SPOM.linkedContent: techno-tele-media apparatuses don’t affect only the facts but concept of “facts”

SPOM.content: figures of death: differance of technical apparatus, iterability, non-uniqueness, prosthesis, synthetic image, simulacrum, all of which begins in language, before language
SPOM.linkedContent: figures of death: differance of technical apparatus, iterability, non-uniqueness, prosthesis, synthetic image, simulacrum, all of which begins in language, before language

SPOM.content: technology separates present from representation more severely than ever
SPOM.linkedContent: technology separates present from representation more severely than ever

SPOM.content: the event we are prowling around (autour duquel nous rôdon) hesitates btwn singular “who” of ghost and general “what” of simulacrum; in dis-locaton, in virtual space of tele-technosciences, le messianique tremble au bord de cet événement même
SPOM.linkedContent: the event we are prowling around (autour duquel nous rôdon) hesitates btwn singular “who” of ghost and general “what” of simulacrum; in dis-locaton, in virtual space of tele-technosciences, le messianique tremble au bord de cet événement même

POR.content: vis-à-vis Heidegger, one can no longer distinguish btwn technology, science, theory and rationality, principle of reason cannot be separated from idea of technology [techno-science]
POR.linkedContent: vis-à-vis Heidegger, one can no longer distinguish btwn technology, science, theory and rationality, principle of reason cannot be separated from idea of technology [techno-science]

POR.content: (143) never before has science been tied so closely to military aims, military technology [Derrida refers to finalisation of research]
POR.linkedContent: (143) never before has science been tied so closely to military aims, military technology [Derrida refers to finalisation of research]

HERP.content: Verfall into optics, spectacle, noise > poets, thinkers not tolerated
HERP.linkedContent: Verfall into optics, spectacle, noise > poets, thinkers not tolerated

MPM.content: to distinguish Gedächtnis (thinking memory) from Erinnerung (interiorizing memory) de Man marks irreducible link btwn memory & technical dimension of memory (art of writing, hypomnesic, exteriority of Mnemon, archivation, data banks, artificial memory) > no deconstruction w/out calling into question dissociation of thought and technology, no longer able to subscribe to Heidegger’s Die Wissenschaft denkt nicht (science does not think)
MPM.linkedContent: to distinguish Gedächtnis (thinking memory) from Erinnerung (interiorizing memory) de Man marks irreducible link btwn memory & technical dimension of memory (art of writing, hypomnesic, exteriority of Mnemon, archivation, data banks, artificial memory) > no deconstruction w/out calling into question dissociation of thought and technology, no longer able to subscribe to Heidegger’s Die Wissenschaft denkt nicht (science does not think)

MPM.content: for Heidegger, thinking of essence of technology is not technology, is free of technicity, same for science [and he would say the same of rhetoric]
MPM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, thinking of essence of technology is not technology, is free of technicity, same for science [and he would say the same of rhetoric]

MPM.content: deconstruction is no longer Heideggerian where he tries to reclaim hierarchy, limit purity by claiming “essence of technology is nothing technology” [or thinking of rhetoricity is not rhetorical]
MPM.linkedContent: deconstruction is no longer Heideggerian where he tries to reclaim hierarchy, limit purity by claiming “essence of technology is nothing technology” [or thinking of rhetoricity is not rhetorical]

MPM.content: Heidegger protects agains abyssal risk of parasitic contamination, of an an-oppositional differance, thus risk and gravity of saying, “essence of technology is not foreign to technology”
MPM.linkedContent: Heidegger protects agains abyssal risk of parasitic contamination, of an an-oppositional differance, thus risk and gravity of saying, “essence of technology is not foreign to technology”

A.content: from kidnapping to hostage war (different modes of technology)
A.linkedContent: from kidnapping to hostage war (different modes of technology)

EM.content: for Heidegger, what is threatened in extension of metaphysics & technology is the essence of man, devastation of languages threat to essence of humanity
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, what is threatened in extension of metaphysics & technology is the essence of man, devastation of languages threat to essence of humanity

OH.content: following program—application of know-how > ethics & politics become a technology, no longer order of practical reason or decision, begins to be irresponsible
OH.linkedContent: following program—application of know-how > ethics & politics become a technology, no longer order of practical reason or decision, begins to be irresponsible

VP.content: the complicity of idealization and the voice are unfailing: brings monstration [?] to completion; unity of phonē and technē, voice as technical mastery of the object, via objectivity of object > the ideal object can be repeated, to infinity, while remaining the same
VP.linkedContent: the complicity of idealization and the voice are unfailing: brings monstration [?] to completion; unity of phonē and technē, voice as technical mastery of the object, via objectivity of object > the ideal object can be repeated, to infinity, while remaining the same

S.content: acc. Heidegger, essence of technology is not technological; Derrida: what if it is? what is this desire for rigorous non-contamination? > envisage fatal necessity of a contamination
S.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, essence of technology is not technological; Derrida: what if it is? what is this desire for rigorous non-contamination? > envisage fatal necessity of a contamination

S.content: “contamination by technology of the thinkable essence of technology”
S.linkedContent: “contamination by technology of the thinkable essence of technology”

FSW.content: Freud augured a beyond and beneath of “Platonic” closure > by opening to theme of writing, writing as technē, as relation btwn life & death, btwn psychical and nonpsychical
FSW.linkedContent: Freud augured a beyond and beneath of “Platonic” closure > by opening to theme of writing, writing as technē, as relation btwn life & death, btwn psychical and nonpsychical

FSW.content: perhaps we need a new name for technology to remove from traditional problematic
FSW.linkedContent: perhaps we need a new name for technology to remove from traditional problematic

FWT.content: technology [telephone, Internet, stock market] dissociates political field from territorial & national field > new concept of political is being forged
FWT.linkedContent: technology [telephone, Internet, stock market] dissociates political field from territorial & national field > new concept of political is being forged

POOF.content: for Heidegger & Schmitt, technics depoliticizes & neutralizes > for Schmitt, though, there is know being-toward-death, only life against life: life confronted w/ the machine qua death is no longer life
POOF.linkedContent: for Heidegger & Schmitt, technics depoliticizes & neutralizes > for Schmitt, though, there is know being-toward-death, only life against life: life confronted w/ the machine qua death is no longer life

POOF.content: in history of partisan Schmitt details, there’s a move away from autochthony (1st partisans were nationalists), & a study of tele-technology (new speeds, new relations to space)
POOF.linkedContent: in history of partisan Schmitt details, there’s a move away from autochthony (1st partisans were nationalists), & a study of tele-technology (new speeds, new relations to space)

POOF.content: tele-technical prosthetic automotion breaks w/ autochthony, cuts telluric roots of 1st guerilla wars
POOF.linkedContent: tele-technical prosthetic automotion breaks w/ autochthony, cuts telluric roots of 1st guerilla wars

POOF.content: [per usual] Derrida will not accept Schmitt’s periodization of the partisan: “telluric autochthony is already a reactive response to a delocalization and to a form of tele-technology” > what Schmitt said of the partisan could have been said of most classical combatant
POOF.linkedContent: [per usual] Derrida will not accept Schmitt’s periodization of the partisan: “telluric autochthony is already a reactive response to a delocalization and to a form of tele-technology” > what Schmitt said of the partisan could have been said of most classical combatant

POOF.content: not simply a problem of periodization: at stake are relations btwn history of the political & the structure of theoretical concepts which one claims to articulate upon it
POOF.linkedContent: not simply a problem of periodization: at stake are relations btwn history of the political & the structure of theoretical concepts which one claims to articulate upon it

POOF.content: re: cybercrime, ‘Clipper’ chip, etc., despite the technological mutation which produces structural effects, there’s fundamentally nothing new here > certainly, but novelty of structural effects mustn’t be neglected: the entirety of the ‘concrete’ in politics
POOF.linkedContent: re: cybercrime, ‘Clipper’ chip, etc., despite the technological mutation which produces structural effects, there’s fundamentally nothing new here > certainly, but novelty of structural effects mustn’t be neglected: the entirety of the ‘concrete’ in politics

POOF.content: for Aristotle, one can not be friends w/ a tool (órganon), friendship irreducible to technologization: requires philía, puskhé, ánthrōpos, díkaion, nómos, sunthékē (convention, contract), koinōnía (communal sharing) > it is thus, out of a relation of proportion, a tendential law, that friendship finds its destiny in democracy
POOF.linkedContent: for Aristotle, one can not be friends w/ a tool (órganon), friendship irreducible to technologization: requires philía, puskhé, ánthrōpos, díkaion, nómos, sunthékē (convention, contract), koinōnía (communal sharing) > it is thus, out of a relation of proportion, a tendential law, that friendship finds its destiny in democracy

POOF.content: Schmitt & Heidegger give credit to oppositional logic (one Nietzsche smiles at) > Heidegger on technological deployment of modern ‘world wars,’ abandonment of Being, man as ‘most important raw material,’ lets his will be unconditionally equated w/ the process
POOF.linkedContent: Schmitt & Heidegger give credit to oppositional logic (one Nietzsche smiles at) > Heidegger on technological deployment of modern ‘world wars,’ abandonment of Being, man as ‘most important raw material,’ lets his will be unconditionally equated w/ the process

POOF.content: Heidegger: in accomplishment of metaphysics, metaphysics becomes ‘psychology,’ psychology & anthropology are last word of metaphysics—psychology & technics go hand in hand
POOF.linkedContent: Heidegger: in accomplishment of metaphysics, metaphysics becomes ‘psychology,’ psychology & anthropology are last word of metaphysics—psychology & technics go hand in hand

POOF.content: via Kant, the deception linked to modesty is moral & egalitarian, creates distance btwn sexes, saves other from degradation, becoming-technical, instrumentalization of jouissance
POOF.linkedContent: via Kant, the deception linked to modesty is moral & egalitarian, creates distance btwn sexes, saves other from degradation, becoming-technical, instrumentalization of jouissance

P.content: for Hegel, art has a single meaning, une vérité une et nue, an etymon, that can be unveiled through history > wouldn’t this mean art is outside of history? but philosophers have always been too quick to deem art historical via opposition tekhnē/physis translated as art/nature
P.linkedContent: for Hegel, art has a single meaning, une vérité une et nue, an etymon, that can be unveiled through history > wouldn’t this mean art is outside of history? but philosophers have always been too quick to deem art historical via opposition tekhnē/physis translated as art/nature

SW.content: “immobile archaism of the fantasy [Oedipus as eye-surgeon?] can outplay w/ its infinite anachronism all the lasers in the world”: (the unconscious) resists translation “in an age of technoscience,” never disarms, nor should we ever > more powerful than technical all-powerfulness
SW.linkedContent: “immobile archaism of the fantasy [Oedipus as eye-surgeon?] can outplay w/ its infinite anachronism all the lasers in the world”: (the unconscious) resists translation “in an age of technoscience,” never disarms, nor should we ever > more powerful than technical all-powerfulness

RGE.content: servility/work as desire for meaning, techne as unfolding of truth > how writing of lordship (which seeks to maintain trace) becomes writing of servility (for Bataille)
RGE.linkedContent: servility/work as desire for meaning, techne as unfolding of truth > how writing of lordship (which seeks to maintain trace) becomes writing of servility (for Bataille)

Gii.content: hand is monstrosité (monstrasity), proper characteristic of man as the being of monstration
Gii.linkedContent: hand is monstrosité (monstrasity), proper characteristic of man as the being of monstration

Gii.content: “can’t talk about hand w/out talking about technology” [Derrida has just recalled photographs of Heidegger’s hands, way the hands seem deliberately staged, overflow the frame]
Gii.linkedContent: “can’t talk about hand w/out talking about technology” [Derrida has just recalled photographs of Heidegger’s hands, way the hands seem deliberately staged, overflow the frame]

Gii.content: acc. Heidegger, sciences belong to essence of technology, not to technology—to its essence; technology remains plunged in a fog (noyée dans un brouillard) > we still do not think (science, no one, is responsible for this) > the most thought-provoking (das Bedenklichste): we still do not think
Gii.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, sciences belong to essence of technology, not to technology—to its essence; technology remains plunged in a fog (noyée dans un brouillard) > we still do not think (science, no one, is responsible for this) > the most thought-provoking (das Bedenklichste): we still do not think

Gii.content: Heidegger’s Hand-werk, an artisanal protest against hand’s defacement in industrial automation of modern mechanization
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Hand-werk, an artisanal protest against hand’s defacement in industrial automation of modern mechanization

Gii.content: Derrida proposes “manuscripture" to Heidegger’s handwriting (Handschrift), given that typewriting, which Heidegger will indict, is also a handwriting
Gii.linkedContent: Derrida proposes “manuscripture" to Heidegger’s handwriting (Handschrift), given that typewriting, which Heidegger will indict, is also a handwriting

Gii.content: Heidegger: typewriter “tears (entreisst) writing from the essential realm of the hand” [MOP]
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger: typewriter “tears (entreisst) writing from the essential realm of the hand” [MOP]

Gii.content: machine “degrades” word into means of commerce, offers the advantage, for those who enjoy degradation, of dissimulation > Heidegger: “typewriter makes everyone look the same”
Gii.linkedContent: machine “degrades” word into means of commerce, offers the advantage, for those who enjoy degradation, of dissimulation > Heidegger: “typewriter makes everyone look the same”

Gii.content: typewriter becomes signless, a-signifying (zeichenlos), it dissimulates, a movement of withdrawal, subtraction (entziehen) [loses the hand]
Gii.linkedContent: typewriter becomes signless, a-signifying (zeichenlos), it dissimulates, a movement of withdrawal, subtraction (entziehen) [loses the hand]

Gii.content: [for Heidegger, all technology of hand is surgery?]

PIO.content: grasp unity of 2 measures of invention: 1) fabula/fictio: art 2) tekhnē, epistemē, istoria, methodos, art, know-how, procedure, knowledge, research
PIO.linkedContent: grasp unity of 2 measures of invention: 1) fabula/fictio: art 2) tekhnē, epistemē, istoria, methodos, art, know-how, procedure, knowledge, research

PIO.content: coming about (survenue) of the new always due to operation of human subject, invention always belongs to man as inventing subject, techno-epistemo-anthropocentric > invention’s value inscribed in structures that bind technical order w/ metaphysical humanism (differentially)
PIO.linkedContent: coming about (survenue) of the new always due to operation of human subject, invention always belongs to man as inventing subject, techno-epistemo-anthropocentric > invention’s value inscribed in structures that bind technical order w/ metaphysical humanism (differentially)

PIO.content: Derrida links tekhnē/fabula and historia/epistemē > man defined by human subject’s aptitude for invention: 1) narrative fiction, historical fabulation 2) technical or technnoepistemic innovation
PIO.linkedContent: Derrida links tekhnē/fabula and historia/epistemē > man defined by human subject’s aptitude for invention: 1) narrative fiction, historical fabulation 2) technical or technnoepistemic innovation

PIO.content: the 2nd notion of invention [dispositif] haunts & thus magnetizes the 1st [unveil what’s there] > this haunting at heart of question re: modern tekhnē
PIO.linkedContent: the 2nd notion of invention [dispositif] haunts & thus magnetizes the 1st [unveil what’s there] > this haunting at heart of question re: modern tekhnē

RM.content: for Heidegger, Metasprache and Sputnik are the same, monstrous project of father, of metaphysics (mastery of form for form’s sake)
RM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, Metasprache and Sputnik are the same, monstrous project of father, of metaphysics (mastery of form for form’s sake)

TR.content: machine structurally resembles causa sui, figure of God, question of technical as question of theological: Bergson’s “machine for making gods”
TR.linkedContent: machine structurally resembles causa sui, figure of God, question of technical as question of theological: Bergson’s “machine for making gods”

WAP.content: double bind of techno-science (formalization)/philosophy (mother/natural tongue): 1) formalization of techno-science resists monolingual hegemony of philosophy as onto-encylopedia—science of sciences 2) philosophy can still point to dogmatic philosophemes in science
WAP.linkedContent: double bind of techno-science (formalization)/philosophy (mother/natural tongue): 1) formalization of techno-science resists monolingual hegemony of philosophy as onto-encylopedia—science of sciences 2) philosophy can still point to dogmatic philosophemes in science

D.content: technicity as metaphor that transports life into death, a non-accidental extra, which, in its act of falling (en y tombant): la branche (plugs it in) et la déclenche (and triggers it off): “force vivante”
D.linkedContent: technicity as metaphor that transports life into death, a non-accidental extra, which, in its act of falling (en y tombant): la branche (plugs it in) et la déclenche (and triggers it off): “force vivante”

TN.content: death introduces drive of expropriation, but is still more tolerable than prosthesis, metonymic substitute, technical survival [l’intrus] (complicates incarnation even more)
TN.linkedContent: death introduces drive of expropriation, but is still more tolerable than prosthesis, metonymic substitute, technical survival [l’intrus] (complicates incarnation even more)

TN.content: Nancy moves dialecticized Judeo-Christian-Islamic “fellow” (residing in particular and universal) into technē > the true “creation” and “art” of our world
TN.linkedContent: Nancy moves dialecticized Judeo-Christian-Islamic “fellow” (residing in particular and universal) into technē > the true “creation” and “art” of our world

TN.content: for Husserl, where sight requires the technical [to see itself] (in sense of mediation and in sense of “intruder”), touch’s self-relation is immediate, spontaneous, direct, intuitive and acts w/out empathy or analogical appresentation
TN.linkedContent: for Husserl, where sight requires the technical [to see itself] (in sense of mediation and in sense of “intruder”), touch’s self-relation is immediate, spontaneous, direct, intuitive and acts w/out empathy or analogical appresentation

TN.content: Husserl analyzes solipsism w/ figure of manual touching and Herzgefühl, “heart sensation”
TN.linkedContent: Husserl analyzes solipsism w/ figure of manual touching and Herzgefühl, “heart sensation”

TN.content: but could I feel my heart w/out technē or grammar (grammar, like rhetoric, a form of technē)?
TN.linkedContent: but could I feel my heart w/out technē or grammar (grammar, like rhetoric, a form of technē)?

TN.content: Nancy’s technē deconstructs system of ends: always “technē of the next one (du prochain)”
TN.linkedContent: Nancy’s technē deconstructs system of ends: always “technē of the next one (du prochain)”

TN.content: one should take the technical supplement into account
TN.linkedContent: one should take the technical supplement into account

TN.content: to proclaim “essential originarity” of technical [as Nancy does] translates this “law” into a classical language that meets its limit here
TN.linkedContent: to proclaim “essential originarity” of technical [as Nancy does] translates this “law” into a classical language that meets its limit here

TN.content: mechanical technique (esp. machines) as a simulacrum of “sensible”—does not feel itself feel, does not hierarchize the “5 senses”: opens place for metonymic substitution
TN.linkedContent: mechanical technique (esp. machines) as a simulacrum of “sensible”—does not feel itself feel, does not hierarchize the “5 senses”: opens place for metonymic substitution

TN.content: Nancy links a dissemination of haptics w/ body’s technical character
TN.linkedContent: Nancy links a dissemination of haptics w/ body’s technical character

TN.content: via Nancy, there is no “the” technical is an exemplary example, plus qu’un exemple, gives privileged access to all “there is no ‘the’…”’s > le vertige quasi transcendantal
TN.linkedContent: via Nancy, there is no “the” technical is an exemplary example, plus qu’un exemple, gives privileged access to all “there is no ‘the’…”’s > le vertige quasi transcendantal

TN.content: it’s because there’s some technical (which there is not) that one can infinitely repeat examples that deconstruct very properness/unity itself of all essences, “beings”
TN.linkedContent: it’s because there’s some technical (which there is not) that one can infinitely repeat examples that deconstruct very properness/unity itself of all essences, “beings”

TN.content: “facts of the day” [i.e. computer, cybersex], artefactual haunts and works through technics & desire (and work in general)—same labor, same pleasure, same torture, tripalium
TN.linkedContent: “facts of the day” [i.e. computer, cybersex], artefactual haunts and works through technics & desire (and work in general)—same labor, same pleasure, same torture, tripalium

BSi.content: for Freud, thanks to technology, mastery over nature, man has become a “prosthetic God”
BSi.linkedContent: for Freud, thanks to technology, mastery over nature, man has become a “prosthetic God”

BSi.content: [via Celan via Büchner’s Danton’s Death] art as species of marionette > marionette: an allegorical personification of technē, technical who and what
BSi.linkedContent: [via Celan via Büchner’s Danton’s Death] art as species of marionette > marionette: an allegorical personification of technē, technical who and what

BSi.content: curiosus: avid knowledge and care (cura), Heidegger’s unwholesome curiosity (Neugier, Neugierde) > curious in the beast, in the madman (zoo, asylum): caring and locking up, installing limits, an art and technique, perhaps tekhnē itself
BSi.linkedContent: curiosus: avid knowledge and care (cura), Heidegger’s unwholesome curiosity (Neugier, Neugierde) > curious in the beast, in the madman (zoo, asylum): caring and locking up, installing limits, an art and technique, perhaps tekhnē itself

BSi.content: Heidegger against science: the face nature turns toward man’s technical mastery might simply conceal her essence
BSi.linkedContent: Heidegger against science: the face nature turns toward man’s technical mastery might simply conceal her essence

OG.content: writing & technique se confound (merge) > technique doesn’t clarify thought of writing
OG.linkedContent: writing & technique se confound (merge) > technique doesn’t clarify thought of writing

OG.content: if cybernetics ousts metaphysical concepts soul, life, value, choice & memory, it must conserve notion of writing, trace, grammè, grapheme—until its own historico-metaphysical character is exposed [cybernetic program will be the field of writing]
OG.linkedContent: if cybernetics ousts metaphysical concepts soul, life, value, choice & memory, it must conserve notion of writing, trace, grammè, grapheme—until its own historico-metaphysical character is exposed [cybernetic program will be the field of writing]

OG.content: grammè (or grapheme), not human or nonhuman, not simple, can’t be defined w/in oppositions of metaphysics
OG.linkedContent: grammè (or grapheme), not human or nonhuman, not simple, can’t be defined w/in oppositions of metaphysics

OG.content: cybernetics & mathematics extend possibility of “message,” its no longer the written translation of a language, the transporting of a signified whose integrity remains
OG.linkedContent: cybernetics & mathematics extend possibility of “message,” its no longer the written translation of a language, the transporting of a signified whose integrity remains

OG.content: how to think possibility of techné, of machine, w/out becoming technicist, teleological? it’s impossible [?] > recapture unity of body & language, tool & thought, w/out thinking they’re unity in a system where they’re opposed, w/out succumbing to confusionism; Leroi-Gourhan’s pluri-dimensional “mythogram”—beyond linearity & simultaneity (simultaneity still linear because it brings two absolute points of presence together)
OG.linkedContent: how to think possibility of techné, of machine, w/out becoming technicist, teleological? it’s impossible [?] > recapture unity of body & language, tool & thought, w/out thinking they’re unity in a system where they’re opposed, w/out succumbing to confusionism; Leroi-Gourhan’s pluri-dimensional “mythogram”—beyond linearity & simultaneity (simultaneity still linear because it brings two absolute points of presence together)

OG.content: trait permits imitation, donner lieu to art as mimesis, possibility of iteration, this life & death of art > technique & imitation: opens space of calculation (grammaticality, scientific intervals)

OG.content: science, philosophy, epistémè, movement of idealization, privilege of logos is that of phonetic writing, of a more algebraic, economical writing (by reason of certain condition of knowledge): mondial effacement of signifier > one believes one is exalting parole, when in fact, one is fascinated by a figure of technè
